original: NORDIN, John Vilhelm, Ordförande och chef för Arbetsrådet, Stockholm, f Skara 27/7 82 av ing Wilh N o Emma Stohlander, gm Hildur Versteegh. Studex 00, jur kand Upps 06. Eft tingstjg aman i ÖÄ 10, notarie i Riksförsäkr.-anst 14, sekr 16, ledamot 17, sekr o föredragande i Arbetsrådet 20, ledamot 24, ordf o ch 26. Led av deleg f det internat socialpolit samarb 40, av k m:t förordnad ordf i Telegrafvkts, Tullvkts o Stat Vattenf.vks tjg.nämnder, ordf i ett flert utredningsktéer, sakkunniguppdrag mm, regeringsdelegat v internat arb.konf i Geneve 36—39. V. ordf i Nord Administrativa Frbs sv avd, ordf i Västgöta Gille i Sthlm. Företagit ett flert utl resor i offentl uppdrag. Av trycket: Utredn ang den faktiska invaliditeten h Riksförsäkr.anst:s livräntetagare (21), Utredn rör lagstiftn om arb.-tidens begränsn i vissa främm länder (25), Arb.tidslagen o Arb.rådet (27), Washingtonkonv o åtta-timmarslagen i utl (30), Invaliditet v olycksf.skador (32), Åtta-timmarslagen (38), Olycksf.skada o sjukdom (35), Olycksf i arbete (36), Lantarbetstidslagen (37), Förebygg av olycksf inom skogshanteringen (38), Arb.rådet o lantarbetstidslagen (38), Arbetstidslagen f detaljhdln o butikstängningslagen (39), Förebygg av olycksf inom cellulosaind (39), Arb.rådet o arbetstidslagen f detaljhdln (40), Förebygg av olycksf inom jordbruket (40), Förebygg av olycksf inom bageriind (41), Arbetstidslagen f detaljhdln o butikstängningslagen (42), Lantarbetstidslagen (42) Förebygg av olycksf inom sågverksind (42), Yrkessjukdomar (43), Förebygg av olycksf inom konservind (43). KNO1kl, RVO, KDDO1gr, KIFO1kl, KNS:tOOmkr, KSpICO1kl, KBKrO, KFinlVRO, KNedOHO, OffBLeopII:sO, OffItKrO, OffLEkkrO, OffSerbS:tSO, RFrHL.
translated: NORDIN, John Vilhelm, Chairman and Chief of the Labor Council, Stockholm, b. Skara 27/7 1882, son of engineer Wilhelm N and Emma Stohlander, m. Hildur Versteegh. Completed secondary education in 1900, graduated with a law degree from Uppsala University in 1906. Served as a court clerk in the Military Court in 1910, clerk in the National Insurance Institute in 1914, secretary in 1916, member in 1917, secretary and rapporteur in the Labor Council in 1920, member in 1924, chairman and chief in 1926. Member of delegations for international social policy cooperation in 1940, appointed chairman of the Telecommunications Guard, Customs Guard, and State Waterways Service boards by the government, chairman of various investigation committees, expert assignments, etc. Government delegate to international labor conferences in Geneva from 1936 to 1939. Vice chairman of the Northern Administrative District of the Swedish Federation of Administration, chairman of the Västgöta Guild in Stockholm. Undertook numerous foreign trips on official assignments. Publications: Investigation of the actual invalidity among the pensioners of the National Insurance Institute (1921), Investigation of legislation regarding the limitation of working hours in certain foreign countries (1925), The Working Hours Act and the Labor Council (1927), Washington Convention and the eight-hour law in foreign countries (1930), Invalidity from accidents and injuries (1932), The Eight-Hour Law (1938), Accident injuries and illness (1935), Accidents at work (1936), Agricultural working hours law (1937), Prevention of accidents in forestry (1938), The Labor Council and the working hours law for retail trade and the shop closing law (1938), Prevention of accidents in the cellulose industry (1939), The Labor Council and the working hours law for retail trade (1940), Prevention of accidents in agriculture (1940), Prevention of accidents in the bakery industry (1941), The working hours law for retail trade and the shop closing law (1942), Agricultural working hours law (1942), Prevention of accidents in the sawmill industry (1942), Occupational diseases (1943), Prevention of accidents in the canning industry (1943). Knight of the Royal Order of the North Star (KNO1kl), Knight of the Royal Order of Vasa (RVO), Knight Commander of the Order of the Polar Star (KDDO1gr), Knight of the Order of Industrial and Intellectual Merit (KIFO1kl), Knight of the Order of the Sword (KNS:tOOmkr), Knight Commander of the Order of Saint Charles (KSpICO1kl), Knight of the Order of the Red Banner of Labor (KBKrO), Knight of the Order of the Finnish Lion (KFinlVRO), Knight of the Order of Orange-Nassau (KNedOHO), Officer of the Order of Leopold II of Belgium (OffBLeopII:sO), Officer of the Order of the Italian Crown (OffItKrO), Officer of the Order of the Legion of Honor (OffLEkkrO), Officer of the Serbian Order of the White Eagle (OffSerbS:tSO), Royal Swedish Freemason's Medal of Honor (RFrHL).
